A little more about me

Know more

Why coding?

Coding is fun!

I have always liked solving problems. That is why I decided to study Mathematics. During my studies I learned more and more about programming. Then I got very interested in creating things by myself.

About my learning experience

My first programming classes (as a bachelors student) were in C and then C++. I really liked programming since then, but I didn't give myself the opportunity to work on personal projects.

Later on (during my master's classes) I learned some Python. Immediately I had conflict with some aspects, like the impossibility of using brackets to define the scope of functions or the odd ability to redefine anything into anything (for example, a function into a variable). We never learned about Python. We only learned how to use it to solve numerical problems. But I got curious. I then took the Zero To Mastery course on Python and I really enjoyed it. I discovered how flexible it is and how many things I could try to create with Python.

Then I took the Zero To Mastery course on web development. Now I am very curious about creating projects not only on my computer, but projects that anyone can use on the internet. Now I want to explore more about this.

I am open to learning languages like go or java. Maybe to learn again about C/C++ or continue using Python and JS. I am very curious and I am sure I can find many other topics that I enjoy. This is just what I have discovered up until now, not what I have decided to continue with.

Future goals

Some of my future goals include:

  • Learning go. Including how to use it for a server
  • Write some servers in Python
  • Work on a web version for some of my Python projects
  • Create a web app where 2 or more people can interact and possibly play something (here a little I have learned about it. On Python for now)
